newsitem.title: USA: Wash. Water Power files to cut Ore. gas rate.
newsitem.headline: Wash. Water Power files to cut Ore. gas rate.

text.p: WP Natural Gas, a division of Washington Water Power Co, filed Tuesday with Oregon Public Utilities Commission to reduce its natural gas rates in the state.
If approved by the Oregon regulators, the utility said it's residential gas customers would see their monthly bill decrease by 7.71 percent, starting Dec 1.
The filing primarily reflects decreases from WP Natural Gas' suppliers in the cost of gas purchased for use by the company's customers.

WWP said this would mark the third straight year it has filed for a natural gas price reduction in the state of Oregon, where its customers' gas rates have decreased by about 15 percent over that period.
